education.name: North Carolina State University
education.degree: B.S. in Computer Scence, Minors in English and Business Administration

Professional Experience.name: Fidelity Investments
Professional Experience.title: Software Engineer
Professional Experience.description:
- Added functionality to make invoicing software, written in C# and ASP.NET, compliant with new 401k Fee Dislcosure regulations. Implemented automated and deploy scripts using NAnt, previously a manual process. Implemented automated NUnit testing for our code base. One of two developers responsible for enhancements and maintainence. 
 - On a separate project, helped convert a 3270-based mainframe application to a web interface, using JSP and Java for web development.

Professional Experience.name: Altissimo Tech, LLC
Professional Experience.title: Owner
Professional Experience.description:
Owner of small business specializing in software and hardware technologies. Currently selling an ATX-to-bench power supply, a device which re-purposes a computer power supply to power other electronic devices. I designed a printed circuit board, plastic enclosure, and the interconnection of all components, in addition to iteratively prototyping the design and launching the final product. 
 Power Supply: http://jaygoel.com/projects/powersupply/

Professional Experience.name: IBM
Professional Experience.title: Software Engineer Intern
Professional Experience.description: Developed data validation tool for Mainframe for Networks on z/OS; responsible for developing design of tool in addition to developing the tool itself; written in C and Java. Developed new functionality for OMEGAMON XE. Maintained testing and automation tools for Linux on z/VM.

Professional Experience.name: Kids Gotta Learn
Professional Experience.title: Software Developer
Professional Experience.description: Developed custom software for company use. Wrote algorithms to automatically generate math practice problems and then create PDF worksheets of those problems. Wrote website using PHP and MySQL, and manage web services and email.

Professional Experience.name: Praxis Studios
Professional Experience.title: Software Developer
Professional Experience.description: Worked with clients and designers to develop custom websites which had PHP front ends and retrieved content from a MySQL database. Upgraded and maintained in-house content management system. Provided first level technical support.

Open Source.name: Github: http://www.github.com/poundifdef
Open Source.description: Open source projects I manage and work on.

Open Source.name: Stackoverflow: http://stackoverflow.com/users/3788/poundifdef
Open Source.description: My contributions to the Stackoverflow programmers' question-and-answer website.

Research and Projects.name: Minutes Checker, Virgin Mobile
Research and Projects.description:
Created and maintain open-source Android application (using Java) to automatically check how many monthly minutes remain on my cell phone plan. The code is hosted on github, and several people have contributed patches. The app has more than 15,000 active users and a 5-star rating on the Android Market. 

 Android Market page: https://market.android.com/details?id=com.jaygoel.virginminuteschecker 
 Github project page: https://github.com/poundifdef/VirginMobileMinutesChecker

Research and Projects.name: Autonomous Glockenspiel
Research and Projects.description:
For a class on wireless sensor networks, we programmed SunSPOT microcontrollers, which use an embedded JDK, to automatically play a physical musical instrument. 

 Videos, pictures, and description: http://jaygoel.com/projects/glockenspiel/

Research and Projects.name: Architecting TCP/IP for SILO Network Architecture
Research and Projects.description:
Wrote honors thesis on how one would architect TCP's functionality within a different networking framework. Implemented prototype of this in C++ on Linux, and created virtual machine images of the stack so that it could be easily deployed and tested. 

Final report: http://jaygoel.com/projects/net-silos/

Research and Projects.name: Practical Graph Mining with R
Research and Projects.description:
(to appear) Wrote book chapter with peers on graph classification algorithms, along with R implementations. 

Source code: http://jaygoel.com/projects/graph-mining/

Awards and Honors.name: Honorable Mention for NSF's Graduate Research Fellowship Program
Awards and Honors.description: The National Science Foundation accepts approximately 2,000 students to provide three years of funding for graduate work along with a living stipend every year. An additional 2,000 students receive an honorable mention and access to NSF grid computing resources.

Teaching and Service.name: Community Volunteer
Teaching and Service.description: Fidelity Investments often provides opportunities for employees to volunteer in local schools. With other colleagues, we set up dozens of donated computers at a local middle school. I critiqued resumes and given career gudiance for high school students, in addition to meeting with students on our campus as part of a Teach for America initiative. I was recognized by the company, with 60 other associates, for my engagement.

Teaching and Service.name: Columnist
Teaching and Service.description: Columnist for the "Technician", NCSU's daily student newspaper.
